trans-unit.source: Certificates and Keys Management Guidelines
trans-unit.target: Certificates and Keys Management Guidelines

trans-unit.source: Certificates and Keys Management Guidelines
trans-unit.target: Certificates and Keys Management Guidelines

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the guidelines for using certificates and keys in <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the guidelines for using certificates and keys in <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: Because certificates and keys expire by design, it is important to track the expiration dates and take appropriate action prior to expiration so that applications that use <token>secondref_acs</token> continue to function properly without interruption.
trans-unit.target: Because certificates and keys expire by design, it is important to track the expiration dates and take appropriate action prior to expiration so that applications that use <token>secondref_acs</token> continue to function properly without interruption.

trans-unit.source: Track expiry and renew certificates, keys and passwords used by the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, relying party applications, service identities and the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service account.
trans-unit.target: Track expiry and renew certificates, keys and passwords used by the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, relying party applications, service identities and the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service account.

trans-unit.source: Objectives
trans-unit.target: Objectives

trans-unit.source: List the certificates and keys that must be tracked for expiration dates
trans-unit.target: List the certificates and keys that must be tracked for expiration dates

trans-unit.source: Outline the renewal procedures for the certificates and keys
trans-unit.target: Outline the renewal procedures for the certificates and keys

trans-unit.source: See the specific certificate, credential or key section in this topic for error messages and renewal process.
trans-unit.target: See the specific certificate, credential or key section in this topic for error messages and renewal process.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Because certificates are guaranteed to expire, it is good practice to upload a new certificate well in advance of the expiration of the current certificate.
trans-unit.target: Because certificates are guaranteed to expire, it is good practice to upload a new certificate well in advance of the expiration of the current certificate.

trans-unit.source: The high-level steps that should be involved are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The high-level steps that should be involved are as follows:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Upload</embeddedLabel> a new secondary certificate.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Upload</embeddedLabel> a new secondary certificate.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Notify</embeddedLabel> the partners that use the service of the upcoming change.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Notify</embeddedLabel> the partners that use the service of the upcoming change.

trans-unit.source: Partners should update their certificate configuration for their relying parties (for example, a thumbprint of the certificate configured in web.config under trustedIssuers node in an ASP.NET web application)
trans-unit.target: Partners should update their certificate configuration for their relying parties (for example, a thumbprint of the certificate configured in web.config under trustedIssuers node in an ASP.NET web application)

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Switch signing</embeddedLabel> to the new certificate (mark it primary) while leaving the previous one in place for a reasonable grace period.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Switch signing</embeddedLabel> to the new certificate (mark it primary) while leaving the previous one in place for a reasonable grace period.

trans-unit.source: After the grace period ends, <embeddedLabel>remove </embeddedLabel>the old certificate.
trans-unit.target: After the grace period ends, <embeddedLabel>remove </embeddedLabel>the old certificate.

trans-unit.source: When a certificate or a key expires, attempts by <token>secondref_acs</token> to issue tokens fail and the relying party application cannot operate properly.
trans-unit.target: When a certificate or a key expires, attempts by <token>secondref_acs</token> to issue tokens fail and the relying party application cannot operate properly.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> ignores expired certificates and keys, resulting in the same exceptions that would be thrown if no certificate or key was ever configured.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> ignores expired certificates and keys, resulting in the same exceptions that would be thrown if no certificate or key was ever configured.

trans-unit.source: The following sections provide information about managing certificates and keys that <token>secondref_acs</token> uses, how to renew them and how to identify certificates and keys that are nearing expiry or have expired.
trans-unit.target: The following sections provide information about managing certificates and keys that <token>secondref_acs</token> uses, how to renew them and how to identify certificates and keys that are nearing expiry or have expired.

trans-unit.source: To manage certificates and keys for <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s and relying party applications, use the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To manage certificates and keys for <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s and relying party applications, use the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information about these credential types, see <link xlink:href="b75ed5c7-ca81-44a2-8d8d-6a63399f87dd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates and Keys</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about these credential types, see <link xlink:href="b75ed5c7-ca81-44a2-8d8d-6a63399f87dd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates and Keys</link>.

trans-unit.source: To manage credentials (certificates, keys or passwords) of service identities, use the <ui>Service identities</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To manage credentials (certificates, keys or passwords) of service identities, use the <ui>Service identities</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information about service identities, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about service identities, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.

trans-unit.source: To manage credentials (certificates, keys or passwords) of <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service accounts, use the <ui>Management Service</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To manage credentials (certificates, keys or passwords) of <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service accounts, use the <ui>Management Service</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, see <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Service</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, see <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Service</link>.

trans-unit.source: To manage certificates for WS-Federation identity providers, such as AD FS 2.0, use the <ui>Identity providers</ui> page in the ACS Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To manage certificates for WS-Federation identity providers, such as AD FS 2.0, use the <ui>Identity providers</ui> page in the ACS Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="dea613c9-e35c-4731-9411-e7937837b3bb#BKMK_WS-Fed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">WS-Federation identity provider certificate</link> and <link xlink:href="b80c168c-b985-4cb9-9865-7963ba9ef142" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">WS-Federation Identity Providers</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="dea613c9-e35c-4731-9411-e7937837b3bb#BKMK_WS-Fed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">WS-Federation identity provider certificate</link> and <link xlink:href="b80c168c-b985-4cb9-9865-7963ba9ef142" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">WS-Federation Identity Providers</link>.

trans-unit.source: To view and update WS-Federation identity provider certificates and keys programmatically, use the <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Service</link>.
trans-unit.target: To view and update WS-Federation identity provider certificates and keys programmatically, use the <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Service</link>.

trans-unit.source: To verify the effective dates of a certificate, query the values of the <parameterReference>StartDate</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>EndDate</parameterReference> properties of the <link xlink:href="0c6268e7-774a-4cb3-a17a-43773a2d0cf0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">IdentityProviderKey</link> entity.
trans-unit.target: To verify the effective dates of a certificate, query the values of the <parameterReference>StartDate</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>EndDate</parameterReference> properties of the <link xlink:href="0c6268e7-774a-4cb3-a17a-43773a2d0cf0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">IdentityProviderKey</link> entity.

trans-unit.source: For more information, download the KeyManagement code sample, <link xlink:href="6a7c9ad5-c120-416c-8667-688f8a6a45d3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Code Sample: Key Management</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, download the KeyManagement code sample, <link xlink:href="6a7c9ad5-c120-416c-8667-688f8a6a45d3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Code Sample: Key Management</link>.

trans-unit.source: When you request a token that is signed by an expired certificate or key, ACS throws exceptions that have <link xlink:href="5ba09d76-7619-40e4-aa8d-ce3d5f3e77f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Error Codes</link> specific to the certificate or key.
trans-unit.target: When you request a token that is signed by an expired certificate or key, ACS throws exceptions that have <link xlink:href="5ba09d76-7619-40e4-aa8d-ce3d5f3e77f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Error Codes</link> specific to the certificate or key.

trans-unit.source: Consult the sections below for specific error codes.
trans-unit.target: Consult the sections below for specific error codes.

trans-unit.source: Available certificates and keys
trans-unit.target: Available certificates and keys

trans-unit.source: The following list displays the available certificates and keys that are used in <token>secondref_acs</token> and must be tracked for expiration dates:
trans-unit.target: The following list displays the available certificates and keys that are used in <token>secondref_acs</token> and must be tracked for expiration dates:

trans-unit.target: See the specific certificate, credential or key section in this topic for error messages and renewal process.

trans-unit.target: Token signing certificates

trans-unit.target: Token signing keys

trans-unit.target: Token encryption certificates

trans-unit.target: Token decryption certificates

trans-unit.source: Service identity credentials
trans-unit.target: Service identity credentials

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service account credentials
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service account credentials

trans-unit.source: WS-Federation identity provider signing and encryption certificates
trans-unit.target: WS-Federation identity provider signing and encryption certificates

trans-unit.source: The rest of this topic covers each certificate and key in detail.
trans-unit.target: The rest of this topic covers each certificate and key in detail.

trans-unit.source: Token signing certificates
trans-unit.target: Token signing certificates

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> signs all security tokens it issues.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> signs all security tokens it issues.

trans-unit.source: It uses X.509 certificates to sign SAML tokens for applications.
trans-unit.target: It uses X.509 certificates to sign SAML tokens for applications.

trans-unit.source: When a signing certificate has expired, ACS returns the following errors when you request a token:
trans-unit.target: When a signing certificate has expired, ACS returns the following errors when you request a token:

trans-unit.source: Error Code
trans-unit.target: Error Code

trans-unit.source: Message
trans-unit.target: Message

trans-unit.source: Remedy
trans-unit.target: Remedy

trans-unit.source: No primary X.509 signing certificate is configured.
trans-unit.target: No primary X.509 signing certificate is configured.

trans-unit.source: A signing certificate is required for SAML.
trans-unit.target: A signing certificate is required for SAML.

trans-unit.source: If the chosen relying party uses SAML tokens, ensure that a valid X.509 certificate is configured for the relying party or the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: If the chosen relying party uses SAML tokens, ensure that a valid X.509 certificate is configured for the relying party or the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: The certificate must be set to primary and must not be expired.
trans-unit.target: The certificate must be set to primary and must not be expired.

trans-unit.source: To renew a signing certificate:
trans-unit.target: To renew a signing certificate:

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select a certificate with a status of <embeddedLabel>Near expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select a certificate with a status of <embeddedLabel>Near expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> section, certificates and keys for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> are labeled <ui>Service Namespace</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> section, certificates and keys for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> are labeled <ui>Service Namespace</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Enter or generate a certificate as required.
trans-unit.target: Enter or generate a certificate as required.

trans-unit.source: Update the <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.
trans-unit.target: Update the <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to complete.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to complete.

trans-unit.source: Token signing key
trans-unit.target: Token signing key

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> signs all security tokens it issues.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> signs all security tokens it issues.

trans-unit.source: ACS uses 256-bit symmetric signing keys for applications that consumes SWT tokens issued by <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: ACS uses 256-bit symmetric signing keys for applications that consumes SWT tokens issued by <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: When signing keys expire, ACS returns the following errors when you request a token:
trans-unit.target: When signing keys expire, ACS returns the following errors when you request a token:

trans-unit.source: Error Code
trans-unit.target: Error Code

trans-unit.source: Message
trans-unit.target: Message

trans-unit.source: Remedy
trans-unit.target: Remedy

trans-unit.source: No primary symmetric signing key is configured.
trans-unit.target: No primary symmetric signing key is configured.

trans-unit.source: A symmetric signing key is required for SWT.
trans-unit.target: A symmetric signing key is required for SWT.

trans-unit.source: If the chosen relying party uses SWT as its token type, ensure that a symmetric key is configured for the relying party or the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, and that the key is set to primary and is not expired.
trans-unit.target: If the chosen relying party uses SWT as its token type, ensure that a symmetric key is configured for the relying party or the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, and that the key is set to primary and is not expired.

trans-unit.source: To renew a signing key:
trans-unit.target: To renew a signing key:

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select a key with a status of <embeddedLabel>Near expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select a key with a status of <embeddedLabel>Near expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> section, certificates and keys for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> are labeled <ui>Service Namespace</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> section, certificates and keys for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> are labeled <ui>Service Namespace</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Enter or generate a key as required.
trans-unit.target: Enter or generate a key as required.

trans-unit.source: Update the <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.
trans-unit.target: Update the <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to complete.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to complete.

trans-unit.source: Token encryption certificates
trans-unit.target: Token encryption certificates

trans-unit.source: Token encryption is required when a relying party application is a web service that uses proof-of-possession tokens over the WS-Trust protocol.
trans-unit.target: Token encryption is required when a relying party application is a web service that uses proof-of-possession tokens over the WS-Trust protocol.

trans-unit.source: In other cases, token encryption is optional.
trans-unit.target: In other cases, token encryption is optional.

trans-unit.source: When encryption certificates expire, ACS returns the following errors when you request a token:
trans-unit.target: When encryption certificates expire, ACS returns the following errors when you request a token:

trans-unit.source: Error Code
trans-unit.target: Error Code

trans-unit.source: Message
trans-unit.target: Message

trans-unit.source: Remedy
trans-unit.target: Remedy

trans-unit.source: Token encryption is required but no encrypting certificate is configured for the relying party.
trans-unit.target: Token encryption is required but no encrypting certificate is configured for the relying party.

trans-unit.source: Either disable token encryption for the chosen relying party or upload an X.509 certificate to be used for token encryption.
trans-unit.target: Either disable token encryption for the chosen relying party or upload an X.509 certificate to be used for token encryption.

trans-unit.source: To renew an encryption certificate:
trans-unit.target: To renew an encryption certificate:

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select a certificate with a status of <embeddedLabel>Near expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select a certificate with a status of <embeddedLabel>Near expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> section, certificates and keys for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> are labeled <ui>Service Namespace</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> section, certificates and keys for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> are labeled <ui>Service Namespace</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Enter or browse to the new certificate file, and then enter the password for that file.
trans-unit.target: Enter or browse to the new certificate file, and then enter the password for that file.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to complete.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to complete.

trans-unit.source: Token decryption certificates
trans-unit.target: Token decryption certificates

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> can accept encrypted tokens from WS-Federation identity providers, such as AD FS 2.0.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> can accept encrypted tokens from WS-Federation identity providers, such as AD FS 2.0.

trans-unit.source: ACS uses an X.509 certificate hosted in <token>secondref_acs</token> for decryption.
trans-unit.target: ACS uses an X.509 certificate hosted in <token>secondref_acs</token> for decryption.

trans-unit.source: When decryption certificates expire, ACS returns the following errors when you request a token:
trans-unit.target: When decryption certificates expire, ACS returns the following errors when you request a token:

trans-unit.source: Error Code
trans-unit.target: Error Code

trans-unit.source: Message
trans-unit.target: Message

trans-unit.source: An error occurred while processing the SOAP header.
trans-unit.target: An error occurred while processing the SOAP header.

trans-unit.source: An error occurred while processing a WS-Federation sign-in response.
trans-unit.target: An error occurred while processing a WS-Federation sign-in response.

trans-unit.source: To renew a decryption certificate:
trans-unit.target: To renew a decryption certificate:

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Use the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> section in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to manage certificates or keys related to <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s and relying party applications.
trans-unit.target: Use the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> section in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to manage certificates or keys related to <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s and relying party applications.

trans-unit.source: Select a certificate with a status of <embeddedLabel>Near expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select a certificate with a status of <embeddedLabel>Near expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> section, certificates and keys for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> are labeled <ui>Service Namespace</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> section, certificates and keys for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> are labeled <ui>Service Namespace</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Enter or browse to the new certificate file then enter the password for that file.
trans-unit.target: Enter or browse to the new certificate file then enter the password for that file.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to complete.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to complete.

trans-unit.source: Service identity credentials
trans-unit.target: Service identity credentials

trans-unit.source: Service identities are credentials that are configured globally for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: Service identities are credentials that are configured globally for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: They allow applications or clients to authenticate directly with <token>secondref_acs</token> and receive a token.
trans-unit.target: They allow applications or clients to authenticate directly with <token>secondref_acs</token> and receive a token.

trans-unit.source: An <token>secondref_acs</token> service identity can be use symmetric keys, passwords, and X.509 certificates.
trans-unit.target: An <token>secondref_acs</token> service identity can be use symmetric keys, passwords, and X.509 certificates.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> throws the following exceptions when credentials are expired.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> throws the following exceptions when credentials are expired.

trans-unit.source: Credential
trans-unit.target: Credential

trans-unit.source: Error Code
trans-unit.target: Error Code

trans-unit.source: Message
trans-unit.target: Message

trans-unit.source: Remedy
trans-unit.target: Remedy

trans-unit.source: Symmetric key, Password
trans-unit.target: Symmetric key, Password

trans-unit.source: Signature verification failed.
trans-unit.target: Signature verification failed.

trans-unit.source: (M Details are in the message.)
trans-unit.target: (M Details are in the message.)

trans-unit.source: X.509 Certificate
trans-unit.target: X.509 Certificate

trans-unit.source: X509Certificate with subject '<Certificate subject name>' and thumbprint '<Certificate thumbprint>' does not match any configured certificate.
trans-unit.target: X509Certificate with subject '<Certificate subject name>' and thumbprint '<Certificate thumbprint>' does not match any configured certificate.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the requested certificate has been uploaded to ACS.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the requested certificate has been uploaded to ACS.

trans-unit.source: To verify and update expiration dates of symmetric keys or password, or to upload new certificate as service identity credentials follow instructions outlined in <link xlink:href="8629f6a5-7463-4fe0-8ec5-66cc2c75a9aa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Add Service Identities with an X.509 Certificate, Password, or Symmetric Key</link>.
trans-unit.target: To verify and update expiration dates of symmetric keys or password, or to upload new certificate as service identity credentials follow instructions outlined in <link xlink:href="8629f6a5-7463-4fe0-8ec5-66cc2c75a9aa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Add Service Identities with an X.509 Certificate, Password, or Symmetric Key</link>.

trans-unit.source: List of service identity credentials available in the <ui>Edit Service Identity</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: List of service identity credentials available in the <ui>Edit Service Identity</ui> page.

trans-unit.source: Go to the <ui>Service identities</ui> page in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Go to the <ui>Service identities</ui> page in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Select a service identity.
trans-unit.target: Select a service identity.

trans-unit.source: Select a credential, symmetric key, password or X.509 certificate with an <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Near Expired</embeddedLabel> status.
trans-unit.target: Select a credential, symmetric key, password or X.509 certificate with an <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Near Expired</embeddedLabel> status.

trans-unit.source: For a symmetric key, enter or generate a new key, and enter <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.
trans-unit.target: For a symmetric key, enter or generate a new key, and enter <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For a password, enter a new password and enter <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.
trans-unit.target: For a password, enter a new password and enter <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For an X.509 certificate, enter or browse to a new certificate file and then click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For an X.509 certificate, enter or browse to a new certificate file and then click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Management Service Credentials
trans-unit.target: Management Service Credentials

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service is a key component of <token>secondref_acs</token> that allows you to programmatically manage and configure settings in an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service is a key component of <token>secondref_acs</token> that allows you to programmatically manage and configure settings in an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: An <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service account can use symmetric keys, passwords, and an X.509 certificates.
trans-unit.target: An <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service account can use symmetric keys, passwords, and an X.509 certificates.

trans-unit.source: If these credentials are expired, <token>secondref_acs</token> throws the following exceptions.
trans-unit.target: If these credentials are expired, <token>secondref_acs</token> throws the following exceptions.

trans-unit.source: Credential
trans-unit.target: Credential

trans-unit.source: Error Code
trans-unit.target: Error Code

trans-unit.source: Message
trans-unit.target: Message

trans-unit.source: Remedy
trans-unit.target: Remedy

trans-unit.source: Symmetric key or Password
trans-unit.target: Symmetric key or Password

trans-unit.source: Signature verification failed.
trans-unit.target: Signature verification failed.

trans-unit.source: (There may be more details in the message.)
trans-unit.target: (There may be more details in the message.)

trans-unit.source: X.509 Certificate
trans-unit.target: X.509 Certificate

trans-unit.source: X509Certificate with subject '<Certificate subject name>' and thumbprint '<Certificate thumbprint>' does not match any configured certificate.
trans-unit.target: X509Certificate with subject '<Certificate subject name>' and thumbprint '<Certificate thumbprint>' does not match any configured certificate.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the requested certificate has been uploaded to <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the requested certificate has been uploaded to <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: The list of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service account credentials is displayed on the <ui>Edit Management Service Account</ui> page in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The list of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service account credentials is displayed on the <ui>Edit Management Service Account</ui> page in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Go to the <ui>Management service</ui> page in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Go to the <ui>Management service</ui> page in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Select a management service account.
trans-unit.target: Select a management service account.

trans-unit.source: Select credentials, symmetric keys, passwords, or X.509 certificate with a status of <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Near Expired</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select credentials, symmetric keys, passwords, or X.509 certificate with a status of <embeddedLabel>Expired</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Near Expired</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For a symmetric key, enter or generate a new key and enter <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.
trans-unit.target: For a symmetric key, enter or generate a new key and enter <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For a password, enter a new password and enter <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.
trans-unit.target: For a password, enter a new password and enter <embeddedLabel>Effective</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Expiration</embeddedLabel> dates.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For an X.509 certificate, enter or browse to a new certificate, and then click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For an X.509 certificate, enter or browse to a new certificate, and then click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: WS-Federation identity provider certificate
trans-unit.target: WS-Federation identity provider certificate

trans-unit.source: The federation metadata document for a WS-Federation identity provider includes a thumbprint that identifies the X.509 certificate that is used to sign tokens for the identify provider.
trans-unit.target: The federation metadata document for a WS-Federation identity provider includes a thumbprint that identifies the X.509 certificate that is used to sign tokens for the identify provider.

trans-unit.source: To determine whether a WS-Federation identity provider certificate is within the range of its effective dates, use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To determine whether a WS-Federation identity provider certificate is within the range of its effective dates, use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>To use the ACS Management Portal:</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>To use the ACS Management Portal:</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Log in to the Azure Management Portal <externalLink><linkText>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=275081</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the Azure Management Portal <externalLink><linkText>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=275081</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Select an Access Control namespace and then click <ui>Manage</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select an Access Control namespace and then click <ui>Manage</ui>.

trans-unit.source: (Or, click <ui>Access Control Namespaces</ui>, select an Access Control namespace, and then click <ui>Manage</ui>.
trans-unit.target: (Or, click <ui>Access Control Namespaces</ui>, select an Access Control namespace, and then click <ui>Manage</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the ACS Management Portal, click <ui>Identity providers</ui> and then select a WS-Federation identity provider.
trans-unit.target: In the ACS Management Portal, click <ui>Identity providers</ui> and then select a WS-Federation identity provider.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Token Signing Certificates</ui> section, view the effective dates and <ui>Status</ui> of the WS-Federation identity provider certificate.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Token Signing Certificates</ui> section, view the effective dates and <ui>Status</ui> of the WS-Federation identity provider certificate.

trans-unit.source: If the certificated status is <ui>Expired</ui> or <ui>Near Expired</ui>, verify that the WS-Federation identity provider (AD FS or a custom identity provider) has added a secondary signing certificate.
trans-unit.target: If the certificated status is <ui>Expired</ui> or <ui>Near Expired</ui>, verify that the WS-Federation identity provider (AD FS or a custom identity provider) has added a secondary signing certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you used a URL to identify the federation metadata for the WS-Federation identity provider, select <ui>Reimport data from WS-Federation metadata URL upon save</ui> and then click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If you used a URL to identify the federation metadata for the WS-Federation identity provider, select <ui>Reimport data from WS-Federation metadata URL upon save</ui> and then click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If you uploaded the WS-Federation metadata as a local file, upload the new WS-Federation metadata file again and then click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If you uploaded the WS-Federation metadata as a local file, upload the new WS-Federation metadata file again and then click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If ACS receives a token from an identity provider that is signed with an expired or unknown certificate, ACS throws the following exceptions.
trans-unit.target: If ACS receives a token from an identity provider that is signed with an expired or unknown certificate, ACS throws the following exceptions.

trans-unit.source: Error Code
trans-unit.target: Error Code

trans-unit.source: Message
trans-unit.target: Message

trans-unit.source: An error occurred while processing the SOAP header.
trans-unit.target: An error occurred while processing the SOAP header.

trans-unit.source: An error occurred while processing a WS-Federation sign-in response.
trans-unit.target: An error occurred while processing a WS-Federation sign-in response.

trans-unit.source: Signature verification failed.
trans-unit.target: Signature verification failed.

trans-unit.source: (There may be more details in the message.)
trans-unit.target: (There may be more details in the message.)
